snippet: Lawyers for former Mayor Ray Nagin of New Orleans asked a federal appeals court Monday to reverse his 2014 corruption convictions, arguing that a judge gave erroneous instructions to the jury.
abstract: Lawyers representing former New Orleans Mayor Ray Nagin, currently serving 10-year sentence on corruption charges, ask federal appeals panel to reverse 2014 conviction, claiming judge provided jury with erroneous instructions.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for former Mayor Ray Nagin of New Orleans asked a federal appeals court Monday to reverse his 2014 corruption convictions, arguing that a judge gave erroneous instructions to the jury.

headline.main: Louisiana: Former Mayor Seeks to Reverse Convictions
headline.print_headline: Louisiana: Former Mayor Seeks to Reverse Convictions
